events.name: YOW! Nights: Property Based Testing
events.description:
In collaboration with YOW! Conferences we're pleased to announce a YOW! Night Singapore with Charles O'Farrell, talking about Property Based Testing - Finding More Bugs with Less Effort. Please don't RSVP on Meetup, but register for this free event at: https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/yow-night-2017-singapore-charles-ofarrell-july-18-tickets-35681475253  Summary: Testing is an essential part of writing and maintaining correct and reliable software. However, for the most part the best technique we have for writing tests is to capture some examples in the hope that they cover all the known edge cases. Unfortunately these examples almost always missing something. What if we could ask the computer to generate these examples? Not just a handful, but hundreds of them that we never even considered. It turns out we can! By using the technique known as Property Based Testing. This talk will explore the motivation and concepts behind this powerful testing technique. We also introduce a number of simple but useful patterns that can be applied again and again when writing properties. In addition this talk will highlight a handful of compelling examples of Property Based Testing uncovering nasty bugs in real world software. Finally, apart from learning about why and how to use Property Based Testing to write better software, the audience will also realise that testing can be made more enjoyable in the process. 


Presenter(s):  Charles O'Farrell is a Software Engineer at Ambiata. He cares about correct and reliable software, and is still learning about it every day. Believes that Property Based Testing is an essential tool for writing good software. 


Sponsor(s):  Thanks to ThoughtWorks for sponsoring the YOW! Nights venue, food, and beverages. 


Agenda: 6:30 pm -- Welcome networking with refreshments7:00 pm -- Presentation followed by Q&A
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: Welcome, Stackers!
events.description: Hello Stackers  Hoping you will be able to join us for next Singapore OpenStack meetup.  Agenda for Meetup  Presenter Dirk Wallerstorfer from dynatrace will be covering  - Full stack troubleshooting and monitoring in OpenStack environments - Container Networking - ceph Storage - looking for speaker Q & A ,General discussion on Emerging technologies & next Meetup directions during drinks break . If you would like to speak/present on any aspect of OpenStack or would like to share real world examples with best practices, challenges, etc please let us know.  Thanks to Dynatrace & Redhat for sponsoring it  !!!
events.location: Red Hat, 8 Shenton Way, 10-01 AXA Tower, 068811 Singapore

events.name: Shopee X DSSG
events.description: For July, we are excited to have Shopee, leading mobile-first marketplace platform in Southeast Asia, to share with us their data science work. RSVP will start on July 9, 2017 Sunday 12:00pm Synopsis: At this meetup, learn how deep learning relates to machine learning and AI as well as their applications in the field of data science. Come meet and hear from our Data Scientists, Pan Yaozhang (Lead), Xiangyu and Yiliang as they share how their understanding of the principles, models and techniques of the above have been validated by their experience at work. The speakers have a wealth of experience in these areas among other knowledge fields, and have served in various positions in both academia and tech. See you there! Program outline: • 6.30pm - 7pm:        Networking • 7pm - 7.15pm:        Introduction to Shopee and Data Team • 7.15pm - 7.45pm:   Deep learning and its applications  • 7.45pm - 8.15pm:   Machine learning model combination                                                   techniques  • 8.15pm - 9pm:        Panel Q&A • 9pm - 9.30pm:        Networking over food and drinks About the speakers: Pan Yaozhang – Ph.D. in EEE from NUS, M.Eng and B.Eng from Harbin Institute of Tech, China, formerly Data Science Lead in Grab and Research Scientist in Greenwave Systems Chen Xiangyu – Ph.D. in Comp Science from NUS, M.Eng and B.Eng from Harbin Institute of Tech, China, formerly AI Tech Lead in Huawei International and IBM Zhao Yiliang – Ph.D. in Comp Science from NUS, B.Eng from NTU, formerly Tech Lead in GovTech Singapore and Asst. Prof in Digipen Institute of Tech Singapore James Han (Panel Moderator) - MBA from INSEAD, with 8 years of experience in Tech, driving cross border e-Commerce growth at Shopee RSVP will start on July 9, 2017 Sunday 12:00pm
events.location: Ascent, 2 Science Park Drive, #03-01, Tower A, Singapore 118222

Amazona •  .NET Core 2.0 RTM and .NET Standard 2.0 RTM by Riza Marhaban That's all. Anyone wants to contribute, just message me. Many thanks and see you at the venue. Organizer

events.name: Smart Sensing Solutions for Smart Nation Applications
events.description: Sometimes companies get overwhelmed by connectivity option available for reaching cloud - Bluetooth, BLE,Wifi, GSM, subGhz, zigbee, LoRa, Sigfox, NB IOT etc. However, if you are designing a connected device such as smartwatches, Fitness-Bands, Smart-Insoles etc, you need to select the right sensors and MEMs at early stage of design, technology that not only is powerful, and comes with lot of features for connected world, but also fits in the industrial designs of your product.  Key areas to consider are:  • Data to be transferred • Range required • How to reach cloud : Smartphone, gateway, infrastructure  • Power budget • Cost  • Open or closed cloud network   Every technology has pros and cons  above questions will help to reach decision easier.  In this session hosted by IoTSG you will learn how to address above topics.  Vishal Goyal is Senior Manager of Technical Marketing at STM. He Manages ASEAN, ANZ and India the Smartphone, IOT, wearable, MEMS and sensor Hub, Microphone, Sensor, Wireless, Audio and Analog products [AMS]. He has 15 years of experience in marketing, business development and design, driving TOP Programs, marketing campaigns and ensuring the promotion, implementation of projects.  DATE & AGENDA:  Tuesday, 18th Jul, 2017 ·  6:45pm: Networking & Registration ·  7:00pm: Introduction and Talk by Vishal ·  8:15pm: Networking & refreshment  VENUE: BASH, 79  Ayer Rajah Crescent, Level 3, S139955   ***************************************************************** Note: Please note that photography and videography may be carried out throughout the event.  IoT SG, Event Sponsors, Supporters may use some or all of these images in its print publications, digital, social platforms and/or marketing channels. We also ask some personal information and questions during registration. This data is used to do further due diligence to improve the quality of events. This data may also be shared with sponsoring organisations, speakers to help them to collaborate more efficiently. We do not sell your data.
events.location: BASH,, 79  Ayer Rajah Crescent, Level 3, S139955 , Singapore
